sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"学生"之意。
means: pupil ： 特指中小学生，尤其是小学生。
student ： 普通用词，可指中学生，但主要指高等学校或专科学校的学生。
learner ： 通俗用词，指某一门学问上的初学者，尤指成年的初学者。
scholar ： 可指一切学生，尤指学识渊博的某一学科的学者。

word_mean: 瞳孔：位于眼虹膜中心的孔洞，光线经此进入眼内。见iris
位于黑睛后方，虹彩中央，形圆而能开缩的圆孔，有调节进入眼内光线的作用。

sentence.Network_en: After his education, Goldschmidt became a pupil of the composer Franz Schreker.
sentence.Network_cn: 学业结束后，戈尔德施米特成了作曲家弗朗兹·施雷克尔的学生。

sentence.Network_en: This can cause regression in a pupil's learning process.
sentence.Network_cn: 这可能会使学生在学习过程中退步。

sentence.Network_en: As a girl she had been a model pupil.
sentence.Network_cn: 还是个小女孩的时候，她就是一个模范学生。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'orphan, ward'): from Old French pupille, from Latin pupillus (diminutive of pupus 'boy') and pupilla (diminutive of pupa 'girl')
late Middle English: from Old French pupille or Latin pupilla, diminutive of pupa 'doll' (so named from the tiny reflected images visible in the eye)

entry.def: The pupils of a school are the children who go to it.

example.ex: Over a third of those now at secondary school in Wales attend schools with over 1,000 pupils...
example.tran: 威尔士现在的初中生中有1/3以上的人就读的学校学生总数超过1,000人。

example.ex: Eleanor was a reluctant, anxious pupil.
example.tran: 埃莉诺是个扭捏局促的小学生。

entry.def: A pupil of a painter, musician, or other expert is someone who studies under that expert and learns his or her skills.

example.ex: After his education, Goldschmidt became a pupil of the composer Franz Schreker.
example.tran: 学业结束后，戈尔德施米特成了作曲家弗朗兹·施雷克尔的学生。

entry.def: The pupils of your eyes are the small, round, black holes in the centre of them.

means.word_mean: 1. a learner who is enrolled in an educational institution
2. contractile aperture in the iris of the eye
3. a young person attending school (up through senior high school)

auth_sentence.content: One pupil and teacher skip along side by side.
auth_sentence.res_content: One pupil and teacher skip along side by side.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: One pupil and teacher skip along side by side.

auth_sentence.content: More arresting sounds follow from Cowell's pupil Harrison.
auth_sentence.res_content: More arresting sounds follow from Cowell's pupil Harrison.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: More arresting sounds follow from Cowell's pupil Harrison.

auth_sentence.content: Each pupil and each staff member having one vote.
auth_sentence.res_content: Each pupil and each staff member having one vote.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Each pupil and each staff member having one vote.

Sentence.sentence: In schools, teachers and pupils alike often assume that if a concept has been easy to learn, then the lesson has been successful.
But numerous studies have now found that when classroom material is made harder to absorb, pupils retain more of it over the long term, and understand it on a deeper level
With the teacher's help, these pupils were able to find the answers to their set of problems.

sentences.en: The pupils replied in one voice.
sentences.cn: 小学生异口同声地回答。

sentences.en: The tenor was a pupil of a singer.
sentences.cn: 这位男高音歌手师承一位歌唱家。

jushi.english: The painting is the work of a pupil of Rembrandt.
jushi.chinese: 这幅画是伦勃朗的一位弟子的作品。

jushi.english: Each pupil has his own desk.
jushi.chinese: 每个学生都有自己的课桌。

jushi.english: I teach a class of forty pupils.
